TopicTitle: Save pilot and scrap mission bug.

Articles.Content:
I took a mission to recover a Kerbal and their scrap and it turns out the "scrap" was a %&Ã‚Â£~#@!\* science lab @ 3.5 tonnes so I got the Kerbal back safely but because I had come prepared for a capsule the science lab was 3x too heavy and the craft toppled in the water landing and the act of toppling destroyed the science lab, at which point I didn't get the reward for rescuing the pilot but I did get mission fail for breaking the lab.

The mission archive shows "recover Jauna Kerman on kerbin" as "incomplete" when this is not true and she landed safely and I got notification than she joined my astronauts. So mission fail conditions are broken. The recover "scrap" element showed "failed" which is correct. So failing the scrap recovery broke the recognition of the other mission element. So the condition logic is wrong somewhere.

Also I would like to comment that the mission conditions should warn us about larger objects. The tracking station showed simply that it was a Size A "smallest" object. I don't think a Science lab is the same size as a capsule, shouldn't there be something to indicate the weight or at least the size?
